item.description:
On May 23, I will be running the Run to Home Base road race in support of local servicemen and women returning from combat in Iraq and Afghanistan.

The Run to Home Base is a 9K race organized by the Red Sox Foundation
and Massachusetts General Hospital. The funds raised will go toward the
Home Base Program, a philanthropic partnership that is dedicated to
improving the lives of New England servicemen and women returning home
with combat stress disorders through clinical care, innovative research,
education, family support, and community outreach.

This cause means a lot to me; a friend from college served two one-year
tours of Iraq. Through him, I've had the honor to have met several Army
men and women that willingly signed up to fight overseas.

You can learn more about the race on the website:
OFFICIAL WEBSITE HERE

I've donated $25 to this worthy cause, and I'm asking for your help in
raising funds. Please consider donating $25 or more.

To donate, go to the home page, http://www.runtohomeb... and click on Support a Runner. Type in my first and last name (lindsay silverman) in lower case letters and hit the search button; that will bring you to another page where you can click on my name.

On the next page, click on Make A Donation and follow the prompts.

The deadline to donate is Friday, May 14.

Thanks in advance for your help and support; I deeply appreciate it.


Lindsay

Post Script: I've done the math; 9 kilometers around home base equals
80.7 home runs.
item.name: Run to Home Base 9K - Help support our troops!
